farther.translation[0].definitions[0].de: a greater distance than before or than something else; a comparative form of ‘far’
farther.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: We decided not to go any farther.
Most of them were locals, but some had come from farther afield  (=a greater distance away).
The boats were drifting farther and farther apart.
a resort town farther up the coast
Two miles farther south is the village of Santa Catarina.
farther.translation[0].definitions[1].de: if you do something farther, you do it more or to a greater degree
farther.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: The police decided not to take the matter any farther  (=do more about it).
farther.translation[0].definitions[1].no: In everyday English, people usually say further rather than farther, and furthest rather than farthest:
We decided not to take it any further.
This was the furthest away from home I’d ever been.
farther.translation[1].definitions[0].de: more distant; a comparative form of ‘far’
farther.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: A table stood at the farther end of the kitchen.
